Header.Name: MDrecord_toolService
Header.Description: Profile for tools/services for CLARIN-SHARE v1.0.1; intended ONLY for conversion from the original schema to CMDI

CMD_Element.name: metadataCreationDate
CMD_Element.Documentation: The date of creation of this metadata description (automatically inserted by the MetaShare software)

CMD_Element.name: metadataLastDateUpdated
CMD_Element.Documentation: The date of the last updating of the metadata record (automatically inserted by the MetaShare software)

CMD_Element.name: compliesWith
CMD_Element.Documentation: Specifies the vocabulary/standard/best practice to which a resource is compliant with

CMD_Element.name: revision
CMD_Element.Documentation: Provides an account of the revisions in free text or a link to a document with revisions

CMD_Element.name: MetadataRecordIdentifier
CMD_Element.Documentation: A string (e.g., PID, DOI, internal to an organization, etc.) used to uniquely identify a metadata record

CMD_Element.name: resourceName
CMD_Element.Documentation: The full name by which the resource is known; the element can be repeated for the different language versions using the "lang" attribute to specify the language.

CMD_Element.Documentation: Introduces a short form (e.g., abbreviation, acronym, etc.) used to refer to a language resource

item.AppInfo: Archival Resource Key
Identifier for ArXiv (http://arxiv.org/), a open access repository of preprints, having the format arXiv:1207.2147
It is the Astrophysics Data System bibliographic codes, a standardized 19 character identifier according to the syntax yyyyjjjjjvvvvmppppa

Value for LRTIdentifierScheme referring to the identifier assigned by META-SHARE (http://www.meta-share.org/)

CMD_Element.name: logo
CMD_Element.Documentation: Links to a symbol or graphic object used to identify an entity; please, add a URL with an image file

CMD_Element.name: version
CMD_Element.Documentation: Associates a language resource with a pattern that indicates its version; the recommended way is to follow the semantic versioning guidelines (http://semver.org) and use a numeric pattern of the form major_version.minor_version.patch

CMD_Element.name: versionDate
CMD_Element.Documentation: Identifies the date associated with the version of the language resource being described (as a recommendation, of the latest update of the particular version)

CMD_Element.name: updateFrequency
CMD_Element.Documentation: Specifies the frequency with which the resource is updated

CMD_Element.name: revision
CMD_Element.Documentation: Provides an account of the revisions in free text or a link to a document with revisions

CMD_Element.name: citationText
CMD_Element.Documentation: Provides the text that must be quoted for citation purposes when using a language resource

CMD_Element.name: publicationDate
CMD_Element.Documentation: Specifies the date when a language resource has been made available to the public

CMD_Element.name: creationStartDate
CMD_Element.Documentation: The date in which the creation process was started

CMD_Element.name: creationEndDate
CMD_Element.Documentation: The date in which the creation process was completed

CMD_Element.name: creationMode
CMD_Element.Documentation: Specifies whether the resource was created automatically or in a manual or interactive mode

item.AppInfo: Value for 'Process mode' and its subclasses used for fully automatic processes where the results of the process have undergone no manual edits
Value for 'Process mode' and its subclasses used for processes that include some interaction between the processing tool and the human agent performing the process
Value for 'Process mode' and its subclasses used for processes that are performed manually
Value for 'Process mode' and its subclasses used for mixed processes, usually involving an automatic processing followed by human edits

CMD_Element.name: function
CMD_Element.Documentation: Specifies the operation/function/task that a software object performs

CMD_Element.name: languageDependent
CMD_Element.Documentation: Indicates whether the operation of the tool or service is language dependent or not

CMD_Element.name: trl

item.AppInfo: Basic principles observed
Technology concept formulated
Experimental proof of concept
Technology validated in lab
Technology validated in relevant environment (industrially relevant environment in the case of key enabling technologies)
Technology demonstrated in relevant environment (industrially relevant environment in the case of key enabling technologies)
System prototype demonstration in operational environment
System complete and qualified
Actual system proven in operational environment (competitive manufacturing in the case of key enabling technologies; or in space)

CMD_Element.name: evaluated
CMD_Element.Documentation: Indicates whether the tool or service has been evaluated

CMD_Element.name: SoftwareDistributionForm
CMD_Element.Documentation: The medium, delivery channel or form (e.g., source code, API, web service, etc.) through which a software object is distributed

CMD_Element.name: executionLocation
CMD_Element.Documentation: A URL where the resource (mainly software) can be directly executed

CMD_Element.name: downloadLocation
CMD_Element.Documentation: A URL where the language resource (mainly data but also downloadable software programmes or forms) can be downloaded from

CMD_Element.name: dockerDownloadLocation
CMD_Element.Documentation: A location where the software in the form of a docker image can be downloaded from

CMD_Element.name: serviceAdapterDownloadLocation
CMD_Element.Documentation: he URL where the docker image of the service adapter can be downloaded from

CMD_Element.name: accessLocation
CMD_Element.Documentation: A URL where the resource can be accessed from; it can be used for landing pages or for cases where the resource is accessible via an interface, i.e. cases where the resource itself is not provided with a direct link for downloading

CMD_Element.name: demoLocation
CMD_Element.Documentation: Specifies the URL where a user can access the demo of a tool/service

CMD_Element.name: privateResource
CMD_Element.Documentation: Specifies whether the resource is private so that its access/download location remains hidden

CMD_Element.name: attributionText
CMD_Element.Documentation: The text that must be quoted for attribution purposes when using a resource - for cases where a resource is provided with a restriction on attribution

CMD_Element.name: copyrightStatement
CMD_Element.Documentation: Introduces a free text statement that may be included with the language resource, usually containing the name(s) of copyright holders and licensing terms

CMD_Element.name: availabilityStartDate
CMD_Element.Documentation: Specifies the start date of availability of a resource - only for cases where a resource is available for a restricted time period

CMD_Element.name: availabilityEndDate
CMD_Element.Documentation: Specifies the end date of availability of a resource - only for cases where a resource is available for a restricted time period

CMD_Element.name: additionalHWRequirements
CMD_Element.Documentation: Specifies hardware requirements that are needed for running a tool/service

CMD_Element.name: command
CMD_Element.Documentation: Specifies a command line used to invoke a software component

CMD_Element.name: webServiceType
CMD_Element.Documentation: Identifies the type of a web service in accordance to a classification vocabulary that refers to the web service communication protocols

CMD_Element.name: licenceTermsName
CMD_Element.Documentation: The name by which a legal document (e.g., licence, terms of use, terms of service) is known

CMD_Element.name: licenceTermsURL
CMD_Element.Documentation: Links to the URL where the text of a licence/terms of use/service is found

CMD_Element.name: conditionOfUse
CMD_Element.Documentation: Links a licence with a specific condition/term of use imposed for accessing a language resource. It is an optional element and only to be taken as providing brief human readable information on the fact that the language resource is provided under a specific set of conditions. These correspond to the most frequently used conditions imposed by the licensor (via the specified licence). The proper exposition of all conditions and possible exceptions is to be found inside the licence text. Depositors should, hence, carefully choose the values of this field to match the licence chosen and users should carefully read that licence before using the language resource.

CMD_Element.name: licenceCategory
CMD_Element.Documentation: Categorises a licence according to a classification scheme

Value for licence category; for licences that permit processing of data resources that produce research outputs (e.g., training of models, annotations, etc.)
Value for licence category; for licences for resources that can be access only by logged in users

A tool/service may take as input/output more than one different media types.
